p: Rosmarinus officinalis is known as a rich source of polyphenols and volatile oils including molecules such as carnosic, rosmarinic acids, and camphor [ 13- 16]. These compounds display diverse biological activities including antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and anticarcinogenic properties. In aged roosters, Borghei-Rad et al. [ 17] reported that dietary supplementation with rosemary leaves powder improved significantly semen quality, fertility, and hatchability through fighting oxidative stress damages. Similarly, dietary supplementation using other antioxidants, including Vitamin E, selenium, Vitamin C, and enzymatic antioxidant systems, improved significantly animal health and sperm quality [ 18- 21].
